Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.                          About Our Client                         Our client is the first sleep fitness company. They design products at the forefront of sleep innovation. Our client's mission is to make people’s sleep count for more, using innovative technology, detailed design, and proven science and data to personalize and improve each night for everybody—changing the way people sleep forever and for the better.                     Our client wants to fuel human potential through optimal sleep. In 2019, they launched our temperature-regulated smart bed, The Pod. They currently power the sleep of over 60,000 people every night. They have partnered with Barry’s as their Official Sleep Fitness Partner. Our client actively collaborates with Justin Medeiros, 2021 Crossfit Champion and Red Gerard, U.S. Snowboarding Olympic Gold-Medalist. GQ awarded our client the Fitness Reward in 2021, along with receiving the Men’s Health Sleep Award that same year. Our client is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors and recognized as one of the Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies In Consumer Electronics.                                    Our client is looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join their engineering team. The ideal candidate has practical experience with modern ML frameworks, is able to rapidly prototype ideas from the latest research, and has an extensive track record of shipping cutting-edge and impactful ML products.                              How you'll contribute                                      Design and implement machine learning based algorithms that determine a wide variety of biometrics (e.g. sleep stages, HRV), detect medical conditions, and programmatically optimize our users’ sleep.                                   Collaborate with Product Managers and Data Scientists to identify opportunities to impact our client's customers, and plan ML strategy.                                   Orchestrate large scale machine learning data pipelines (experience with Prefect, Airlflow, Luigi, or similar framework will be helpful).                  - Create batch jobs (SQL, pandas / Dask, Spark) that process large scale datasets-E.g. featurization, statistical analyses, extracting insights, etc.                                   Create production services that serve ML predictions.                                              What you'll need to succeed                                      5+ years of software engineering experience                  - High standards for code quality-i.e. you apply principles of clean code and prioritize testing.                                   4+ of experience working in Python                                   Strong experience with Pytorch (or an equivalent deep learning framework), and a general ML toolkit: e.g. numpy, pandas, sklearn, xgboost, H20, etc.                                   Experience creating low latency production ML systems.                                   Masters Degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or 4+ years functioning as a machine learning engineer.                                              Nice to haves:                                      Experience building casual models.                                   Experience conducting A/B tests / randomized trials.                                                Why you’ll love our client                                  They are a tight-knit, passionate team that’s working to improve people’s lives by improving the way they sleep                               Leadership is committed to employees’ wellness and career development                               You’ll get a better night sleep every night                               Flexible, generous PTO                               100% employer contribution for medical/dental/vision insurance                                               Base Salary Range:  150K-190K

job_title: Senior Data Scientist– Computer Vision [USA- Remote]
job_Description: AURA TECHNOLOGIES, LLC (AURA)  is an advanced technology, research and development (R&D) company creating game-changing innovations for the US Department of Defense in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and in other systems-level implementation of cutting-edge technology. We are creating advanced intelligent power systems for the US Army; unconventional tactical lights for the US Marines; revolutionary satellite manufacturing for the US Air Force; and a range of AI platforms for DoD implementation. AURA partners with some of the best companies in the world, such as Boeing, Northrop Grumman, and Lockheed Martin. We also collaborate with the best and brightest at our Nation’s universities, including Georgia Tech and NC State University.        If you are a smart, capable and talented individual who possesses high integrity, thrives in a fast-paced environment, wants to chart your own course based on your capabilities, and is willing to be accountable for failures and successes, then continue reading because you may be the ideal candidate to join our exponentially-growing R&D business.        AURA has an immediate opening for a full-time  Senior Data Scientist– Computer Vision.             ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:      As a  Senior Data Scientist  for computer vision and image recognition, you will develop machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms for visual data. In addition to technical direction for specific assigned projects, your responsibilities will include the following essential duties:          Standardize, normalize, clean, and format data which may include images and video      Utilize computer vision techniques to extract features and build machine learning applications by training on large datasets      Provide recommendations for algorithm development, testing, validation, and model feedback      Produce clear, concise, documented, and production-ready code      Train others to use and maintain developed tools/applications      Work in a team environment to collaborate with coworkers, partners, and clients to produce an integrated solution         Given the demanding, diverse, and fast-paced environment, the  Senior Data Scientist – Computer Vision  must also possess exceptional attention to detail.             WORK EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION & TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:      You must be able to demonstrate prior development of production-level AI algorithms using real-world data. Required skills include the ability to quickly understand and model a novel problem. You must have a strong background in engineering or the hard sciences.        Minimum Years of Work Experience:      Minimum of 3-4 years’ experience in a data analyst, data scientist or similar role (a doctorate may be substituted for experience in the case of a qualified candidate)        Minimum Education :      Masters’ degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or a related technical degree        Minimum Technical Requirements :          At least 3-4 years of practical expertise in computer vision techniques, which may include pose estimation, facial recognition, and motion tracking. Strong experience in preprocessing visual data, including data augmentation techniques specifically for images      At least 3-4 years of practical experience developing machine learning algorithms using programming languages common in the data science profession, such as Python or R      At least 3-4 years of practical experience visualizing and presenting data, using tools that may include Bokeh, Tableau, or Plotly      Demonstrated experience building production-level classification machine learning algorithms, including recommender systems                OTHER DESIRABLE EXPERIENCE:  (Additional experience or status in one or more of these areas is beneficial but not required for consideration):          Embedded image processing, computer/machine vision, and/or AI platforms and/or application development      Fluency in at least one high-level programming language (C/C++, Scala, Java, etc.); fluency in a functional language (Euler, Haskell, etc.) is a plus      Experience in 3D reconstruction (multi-view, structure-from-motion, object tracking, etc.)      Scholarly publications and/or patents relevant to this position                PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS         Prior DoD or military experience      Secret clearance      Doctorate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or a related technical degree                ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:          Candidates  must not  now or in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status      SECURITY CLEARANCE: Once employed by AURA, the successful candidate must be able to obtain a US Government Secret-level clearance or must already possess such clearance. The successful candidate must maintain the clearance during the duration of their employment, which is a requirement of this position. The US Government generally only grants clearances to US citizens who are free from major criminal convictions. Individuals not meeting these two criteria will most likely not be granted a US Government security clearance.                BENEFITS:          401(k) Safe Harbor Contribution      Flexible schedule      Health insurance      Discretionary Leave      14 Paid holidays                TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION :      Submit your cover letter and resume/CV in PDF format via instructions at the following link: auratech.bamboohr.com/jobs.      **Please be sure to add notifications@app.bamboohr.com to your contact list to ensure delivery of all correspondence from us.**      No phone calls after submission. We will let candidates know via an automated reply that we have received their resumes and will contact them if there is a good fit after the closing date for this job.             AURA Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and affirmative action employer of veterans protected under the Vietnam Era Veterans’ Readjustment Assistant Act (VEVRAA). We are a Drug Free Workplace and thus, all job offers are contingent on successful criminal background check and drug screen. As a US Federal Contractor, AURA uses the Department of Homeland Security e-Verify system to determine eligibility to legally work in the United States.

Company Description    We are a biotechnology company changing lives using programmable DNA     Atom Bioworks is a biotechnology company that programs and folds DNA to create next-gen immunoassays and immunotherapies targeting infectious diseases and cancers.     Our mission is to design, develop and bring to market first-in-class nucleic acid based diagnostics and therapy for accurate early disease detection and treatment. Our core technology is the DNA STAR™, a low cost, high affinity DNA molecule rationally designed using AI algorithms to create structures matching the pattern of antigens on the surface of a virus, cell, or other analytes. Our R&D platform seeks to drive innovation at the intersection of machine learning and biology through deep collaborations between wet lab and dry lab scientists and engineers.     We are a team of cross- disciplinary experts in disease diagnostics, drug discovery & delivery, and computer science who are passionate about innovating, combining scientific rigor with an open-minded approach to deliver the next big breakthrough.           Job Description            Provide a broad range of project support including technical, quality/compliance, manufacturing, and commercialization challenges      Plan experimental design, develop, draft SOPs, execute and optimize the synthesis of DNA nanostructures      Execute routine analytical sample testing through ELISA, spectroscopy, biophysical characterization like Agarose-gel electrophoresis, SDS-PAGE      Ensuring compliance to quality and regulatory standards and fostering a positive compliance culture      Manufacturing DNA nanostructures for support of the R&D group      Design and execute method transfers/qualifications of analytical methods based on regulatory guidelines and industry best practices      Generate, manage, analyze and evaluate critical data (including statistical analysis) in a highly organized manner and deliver high quality results verbally, in notes, reports and presentations. Should be able to exercise technical judgment in the design, execution and interpretation of experiments      Develop process development project roadmaps, detailed schedules, and overall project strategy, maintain a thorough understanding of project timelines and milestones, and openly communicate scheduling challenges.      Prepare and/or review technical documents such as protocols, reports, test methods, summary slides and standard operating procedures.      Plan and execute laboratory work for self and junior members of the team      Investigate process automation using the latest lab robots      Process improvement and Troubleshoot method challenges in a creative and controlled manner      Provides expertise and training to junior scientists      Providing technical evaluations and recommendations for mitigation(s) of challenges      Authoring Design History Files, in real time or retrospectively      Design and implement QC/testing activities, including combination product/medical device design verification and human factors testing      Regulatory evaluation, submission authorship and review      All other duties as may be assigned.              Qualifications            Master’s degree in biochemistry, biology, microbiology, biotechnology, life sciences or related field OR      Bachelor’s degree in biochemistry, biology, microbiology, biotechnology, life sciences or related field with 4 years of relevant experience      Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry is preferred but not required      Experience working with DNA preferred      Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and scientific software such as GraphPad/Prism, Wolfram Alpha, etc.      Python programming for data analysis and process automation (for Opentron lab robot) a strong plus      Strong entrepreneurial mindset      Must have extensive pipetting skills      Potential for exposure to hazardous chemicals, gases, fumes, odors, mists and dusts, and other hazardous materials      Ability to lift 50 pounds on occasion and 25 pounds regularly      Ability to wear personal protective equipment (PPE)      Onsite attendance is mandatory        Additional Information    All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

SREE Hotels LLC  is seeking a  Desktop Support Technician  to join the technology team at our Corporate Headquarters in the  Ballantyne Area of Charlotte, NC.   As a  Desktop   Support Technician , you will enjoy professional training & development, responsive corporate support, competitive pay, and an excellent benefits package that includes fully-paid health insurance after 3 years’ of service, dental & vision insurance and a matching 401K.   ABOUT SREE HOTELS LLC As one of the fastest-growing property management groups in the Southeast, SREE Hotels LLC offers our associates unparalleled opportunities for advancement in the Hospitality Industry. The Company currently owns and operates 24 brand name hotels in popular markets like Charlotte, Raleigh, Columbia, Charleston, Cincinnati and Myrtle Beach and we are expanding. Our portfolio includes well-respected brands like Marriott, Hilton, & IHG. Our Corporate Office is conveniently located in the beautiful Ballantyne area of Charlotte, NC with easy access to major highways and airports making travel a breeze. For more information, visit our website at www.sree.com.   Position Overview This position is for supporting the corporate office infrastructure/systems and basic support to remote users for 20+ hotels in the NC, SC, and OH. The Desktop Support Technician will work closely with the IT Director to provide support to users on a variety of issues.   Responsibilities      Provide Desktop Support to all organization employees-approx. 70 users    Configure and troubleshoot routers and networks.    Maintain call logs and follow-up responsibility for support calls.    Create documentation for standard support and escalation procedures.    Document all locations, hardware, networks, equipment.    Helping maintain physical and virtual servers at the corporate office    Maintain Active Directory + Exchange Environment     Competencies      Possess strong skills in hardware and network support, learning, understanding, and supporting new software applications.    Be comfortable and able to operate in a rapidly growing environment.    Understand customer support protocols.    Have familiarity with help desktop type operations.    Possess strong verbal and written communication skills.     The ideal candidate will:       Be a fast learner who is not prone to over-analyzing.    Passion and working experience of all systems involved    Have a clear focus on high quality    Be mature, respectful and measured when interacting with customers and other non-technical departments.    Be comfortable in a growing company environment, utilizing limited resources.    Use good personal judgment and initiative to develop effective and constructive solutions to challenges and obstacles.    Have a friendly and cooperative personality, conducive to substantial phone time with customers.    The ideal candidate will have a basic knowledge and understanding of help desk operations. Additionally, they should possess:    At least 2+ years of previous professional experience supporting IT operations    Help desk support experience    Experience in basic hardware maintenance, networking, and software support.    Valid driver’s license     Required Technologies      Microsoft Exchange Experience    Active Directory Experience    Windows up to version 10    Microsoft Office applications    Networking – Understanding of TCP/IP, DNS, WINS, LAN/WAN, Routers, Firewall    Experience working with 2008 servers – i.e. creating domain accounts, active directory    Experience with computer hardware – installing and troubleshooting/diagnosing    Basic Windows Desktop Support    Experience with iOS devices    Knowledge of Open source application would be helpful.    Knowledge of VMWare / Microsoft Hyper-V     Job Setting and Physical Demands Employees in this position primarily work indoors but may need to perform some work outdoors. To perform the job successfully the candidate must be able to see differences between colors, shades, and brightness, hear sounds and recognize the difference between them, use fingers to grasp, move, or assemble very small objects, make quick, precise adjustments to machine controls. Employees must be able to sit, stand, walk, climb, crawl, reach and lift up to 50 lbs. Fluency in the English language and the ability to speak, hear, read and write are required as is the ability to work any hours/days of the week necessary to meet business requirements.   Disclaimer This job description indicates in general the nature and levels of work, knowledge, skills, abilities and other essential functions (as covered under the Americans with Disabilities Act) expected of people assigned to this position. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. All employees may be required to perform activities outside of their normal job responsibilities from time to time as needed. EOE - All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.   Job Type: Full-time   Pay: $40,000.00 - $42,000.00 per year   Benefits:      401(k)    401(k) matching    Dental insurance    Employee discount    Health insurance    Life insurance    Paid time off    Tuition reimbursement    Vision insurance     Schedule:      8 hour shift    Monday to Friday    On call     Work Location: One location

The Company             An investor-backed startup located in the Raleigh-Durham area, Infinia ML works with Fortune 500 companies, government partners, and healthcare innovators to apply machine learning techniques to their data challenges. Our work is focused on automated document processing, where we automate workflows that have traditionally required a human-level understanding of written content. We are building a flexible, standardized platform for the processing of that written content in documents - think medical records, invoices, insurance claims, emails, etc.        Our technical team is led by Chief Scientist Lawrence Carin, Ph.D., one of the world’s foremost experts on machine learning. As our data scientists build ML algorithms and data processing pipelines, our engineers need to package that technology into consumable software.        The Role        Infinia ML is seeking a Deployment and Support Manager with a desire to join a growing company focused on cutting-edge machine learning (ML) and deep learning technology. We provide our customers immediate value through our technology solutions which are tailored to their data and business needs, in domains ranging from healthcare to human resources and business intelligence. With the use of exciting ML techniques such as natural language processing, optical character recognition, and document extraction, we deliver impactful business insights to our clients.        As part of our engineering team, you will collaborate with a dynamic group of engineers and data scientists to deploy and maintain these ML-powered solutions. We are looking for individuals who are excited about being exposed to new problems and challenges while working in a flexible and versatile environment.        Typical activities will include:             Develop and maintain the platform release processes      Oversee the release of updates to technical systems      Ensure production systems are functional      Work with clients to collect feedback, triage issues, and troubleshoot defects      Manage a team of support engineers      Support the development and implementation of an on-call support team      Collaborate with R&D teams to translate client feedback into high-level requirements                Technologies we use:             Python, JavaScript, and Go      Python web frameworks including Django, Flask, and FastAPI      Vue.js, Tailwind CSS, and Highcharts      Docker, Kubernetes, Vault, Git, CI/CD      AWS and Azure      Ansible, Terraform and similar      PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, S3, and similar                Preferred candidates will have :             Technical understanding of some of the frameworks and technologies listed above      3-5 years of experience in release engineering for microservice platforms and/or SaaS applications      An understanding of potential risks around production deployment activities      Experience leading an on-call technical support team      Strong organizational and time management skills, and be detail-oriented      Ability to communicate effectively to clients and technical teams

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.      If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.          Our Client      Our client helps organizations globally to build trust and speed into their business by matching the Speed of PrivacyOps to the Speed of Dev/BusinessOps. They have clients including Coinbase, Samsara, Twilio, Robinhood, and Flexport.               The Role       The role requires you to think critically and design from the first principles. You should be comfortable with multiple moving parts and microservices architectures. Given you are constructing the foundation on which our global data infrastructure will be built, you need to pay close attention to detail and maintain a forward-thinking outlook as well as scrappiness for the present needs. You are very comfortable learning new technologies and systems. You thrive in an iterative but heavily test-driven development environment. You obsess over model performance and thrive on applying machine learning techniques to business problems.            Responsibilities             Design machine learning pipelines to solve the highest impact business problems in the simplest way        Gather training data, and train and evaluate state-of-the-art models        Work with cross-functional teams, including lawyers, data protection and security researchers        Work with backend developers            You Are A Good Fit If             Have strong experience building natural language processing (NLP) systems, specifically in text classification, entity and relation extraction, summarization, and knowledge base construction        Have strong software engineering skills, are comfortable with Python, and have experience with machine learning and NLP tools and libraries such as scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, spaCy, HuggingFace, Gensim, etc.        Have experience building end-to-end ML pipelines and deploying models to production        Thrive in a self-directed environment with full ownership to design features from scratch and the accountability that comes along        Are motivated by bringing the most value as possible to users, whether this means designing a new feature, training a state-of-the-art model, building an ETL pipeline, recruiting a data labeling vendor, etc.        Learn new ways of thinking about age-old problems                       Benefits:  PTO, Healthcare, and More!                 Base Salary Range:  $140,000 to $200,000

Who You Are:     You are an experienced Lead Data Engineer that will join our Data team to support TrueLearn’s data platform and analytics efforts. As a key member of the Data team, you will be responsible for designing, building, maintaining, and documenting TrueLearn's data workflows and pipelines. You will engage in database architecture design and data modeling discussions with TrueLearn’s Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and Product Managers, as well as participate in developing and enforcing data quality, security, and governance policies across the organization. You will be a key contributor to strategic planning for TrueLearn’s data platform and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. You’ll have the opportunity to work in all aspects of data, including data processing, data management, data governance, data architecture, and more. You will mentor others and become an expert about TrueLearn’s data platform for the organization. We’re looking for a Lead Data Engineer that is deeply technical, analytical, articulate, team-oriented, business-minded, and mission driven to help us push TrueLearn’s platform to the next level and position us well for expansion into new market verticals. If you’re a driven and motivated problem solver who is passionate about leveraging data to help learners and their institutions, then TrueLearn is the right place for you!     What You’ll Do:     Responsibilities for the Lead Data Engineer role include:         Be a key contributor to the design, implementation, automation, and documentation of TrueLearn’s data platform (data architecture, processes, and pipelines).      Collaborate with Data Scientists, Software Engineers, Product Managers, and others across the organization to assist with data-related technical issues and data infrastructure needs.      Use advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases, query authoring, and familiarity with a wide variety of databases to analyze internal/external data and processes to answer specific business questions, as well as identify opportunities for optimization and performance improvements.      Build end-to-end processes for supporting data transformation (standardization, linking, and matching), data architecture, and metadata storage.      Manipulate, process, and extract value from large disconnected datasets.      Partner closely with Data Scientists to create complex data processing pipelines to support analytics efforts, data science solutions, and machine learning model deployments.      Partner closely with Software Engineers and Product Managers to assist in the definition of the TrueLearn platform’s software architecture, specifically around requirements about data ingestion, data processes, and data infrastructure.      Create data models and speak articulately to the tradeoffs of different modeling approaches.      Write clean, self-documenting, and iterative code.      Leverage continuous delivery practices to deploy, support, and operate data pipelines.      Contribute to the development of data quality, security, and governance policies and educate the organization about their importance.      Assist in the development of an ecosystem to support TrueLearn’s cross-functional teams in managing and using their data, as well as research, recommend, and apply new technologies to solve technical challenges.

BioAgilytix is a leading contract research organization (CRO) that specializes in large molecule bioanalysis. Our fully integrated laboratory services support every stage of biologics development, from early discovery through pre-clinical studies and clinical phases, in a fully regulated environment. The best science demands the best people, and our global team of professionals in Durham, North Carolina; Boston, Massachusetts; and Hamburg, Germany bring a passion for helping pharma and biotech companies achieve more for the patients they serve.      In this role, you will apply your real-world, expert insight to help our customers successfully navigate the complexities of large molecule bioanalysis. This role is the singular scientific expert and main contact for our clients through every stage of the project lifecycle. You are also a teacher, mentor and coach to the BioAgilytix project team providing day-to-day leadership both in and out of the lab. Our clients trust us to deliver accurate and reliable results, and this role provides the critical project leadership and continuity they expect. Our clients depend on us to provide solutions, on time and on budget, as a result of their continued relationships with our BPMs and quality of the team’s work.      We are looking for candidates who have proven and deep scientific experience paired with demonstrated leadership presence. Our best candidates are people who have a passion for learning and teaching, with the patience and listening skills to appeal to the perspectives and interests of others. If you are able to balance confidence with humility while driving quality and efficient projects, then you’ll be right at home here at BioAgilytix.      WHAT YOU WILL DO         Design and oversee the execution of development, validation, and sample analysis of biologics, proteins, peptides, small molecules, and/or biomarkers, using various techniques including chromatographic (LC/MS), cell-based, immunogenicity, immunoassays, and/or enzymatic assays for support of preclinical, clinical and product release studies     Partner closely with clients to ensure successful on time execution of deliverables     Manage and lead the team (scientists, analysts, and study coordinators) supporting client solutions, modeling collaboration and teamwork     WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED   Skills         Ability to establish, maintain and deepen working relationships through strong written and spoken communication     Ability to consult with a long-term perspective in addressing customers’ (both internal and external) needs and issues with an intent to strengthen their business     Thorough knowledge of industry best practices of experimental planning and design     Experience working in GxP environments and demonstrated knowledge of GxP regulations     Advanced capabilities in data analysis and data visualization statistical analysis     Demonstrated experience serving in a people management role and leading teams; exhibit active interest in coaching, mentoring, and inspiring others to do their best work and drive results     Competencies and Qualifications Preferred         Bachelor's degree in chemistry, molecular biology, biochemistry, immunology, biotechnology, or related field with not less than ten (10) years' experience in a scientific laboratory environment; or Master’s or PhD. with equivalent experience     Ability to develop cell-based and/or immuno- assays in some or all of the following platforms:     Immunoassay: ELISA, MSD-ECL, RIA, DELFIA, HTRF, and AlphaScreen     Cell-based: Cell reporter assays, cell viability assays, cell second messenger assays     Ability to develop chromatographic assays including LC/MS by extracting analytes of interest from complex biological matrices using protein precipitation, liquid-liquid, solid phase, immunoprecipitation or other extraction technique     Benefits and Other Perks         Medical Insurance (HDHP with HSA; PPO)     Dental Insurance     Vision Insurance     Flexible Spending Account (medical; dependent care)     Short Term Disability | Long Term Disability     Life Insurance     Paid Time Off (4 weeks per year)     Paid Holidays (9 scheduled; 3 floating)     401k with Employer Match     Employee Referral Program (up to $10k)     Free Coffee, Tea, Fruit, and Snacks     Discounted Vending Machines (25 cents for everything!)     Team Wellness Challenges/Events     Disclaimer   The tasks, duties, and responsibilities listed in this job description are not exhaustive. BioAgilytix, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities to employees. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education may be substituted for certain requirements, so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the job description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what is considered equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, this job description does not constitute a contract of employment, either expressly, or by implication. Comments BioAgilytix requires that all employees be legally authorized to work in the United States. In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, BioAgilytix will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization. However, based on USCIS requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. Equal Opportunity Employer BioAgilytix provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, disability, gender identity, results of genetic testing, service in the military, or any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

job_title: QA and ML Data Labeling Specialist at Series A Startup
job_Description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch:     Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.     If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.         Our Client          Data protection goes beyond borders, beyond organizations, and beyond individual teams.             Believing that the global data protection and privacy environments have been far more complex than they should be, our client is reimagining what data protection means in a globalized, technology-driven world.             Now, more than ever, international organizations and data protection professionals need to access data and complex information quickly, conveniently, and in a simplified way.             They are shifting the entire landscape of data protection technology through automation and machine learning.         Role Overview      Relyance AI is seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) and Data Labeling Specialist to help us execute our one-stop privacy platform at the highest level. In this role, you will partner with machine learning (ML) engineers, legal experts, and external vendors to enforce the highest quality in customer-facing predictions of ML models and curate and deliver high-quality labeled data to train these models. By developing and improving QA and labeling workflows, you will play a central role in fostering the culture of high quality and operational efficiency necessary to drive 5-star customer experiences. To succeed in this role, you will have a strong attention to detail and an analytical mindset.      Responsibilities:           Perform QA of customer-facing content in the Relyance AI application (predictions of machine learning models in particular), find patterns in errors, and report on your findings       Collaborate with external vendors, machine learning engineers, and legal experts to curate, QA, and deliver high-quality labeled data       Develop and improve QA and data labeling workflows to drive operational efficiency       Establish and improve metrics collection and reporting          You are a good fit if you have:           A Bachelor’s degree       Strong attention to detail       Strong project management skills       An analytical mindset and an ability to find patterns       Excellent written and verbal communication skills       A strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive       An ability to handle ambiguity and changing priorities       Experience in a QA role (preferred)       Experience working as a paralegal (preferred)       Experience labeling ML data sets (preferred)       Experience writing or editing content for a web product (preferred)       Basic knowledge of Python or other programming languages (preferred)                         Benefits:  PTO, Healthcare, and More!                 Base Salary Range:  $140,000 to $200,000

Principal Architect - Asset Shop            Deloitte Human Capital Consulting         The Human Capital Offering Portfolio focuses on helping organizations manage and sustain their performance through their most important asset: their people. To stay in front, organizations need to have real-time access to Human Capital insights, experts and innovative technology solutions that are designed to not only drive, but sustain and extend organizational performance and engagement. Supporting the products and capabilities of the Human Capital Offering Portfolio, our Asset Shop is full of passionate, energetic, and multi-talented engineers who are excited about building the world's greatest personalized and business friendly applications. Our high caliber engineering team is already making their mark by developing on a variety of current platforms/technologies - .NET, Java, MEAN, MERN, LAMP, Amazon AWS/EC2, Content Management and Publishing, Vertical and Enterprise Search, Multimedia, Blog, Web Analytics and SEO. Soon all of the services will be available on mobile smartphones, iOS and Android tablet devices, followed by implementation of a highly sophisticated and scalable SaaS platform.        Our Asset Shop is seeking a    Principal Architect  to oversee architecture for our Development team. We are modifying existing products and are building new ones. We need someone that is passionate about designing, building, implementing, and maintaining high transaction web-based applications. Someone that knows how to lead and implement the latest Architecture.        We are looking for frontrunners in the field of web application architecture. Someone that is constantly looking to improve the development process through Test driven development, continuous development, automated testing, and other new development methodologies.           Work you'll do         As a Principal Architect you will bring considerable expertise to deliver effective solutions to both internal and external clients. You will be working in a team atmosphere to create innovative solutions that solves our clients' most complex issues.            Manage day to day interactions with executive clients and sponsors      Manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies.      Leading teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures.      Assisting Product Managers with application architecture design, assessment and optimization including definition, documentation and implementation of new application architectures      Review and evaluation of key attributes of existing application architectures      Recommend and validate improvements to existing Application Architectures      Develop and maintain contact with top decision makers; participate and lead aspects of the proposal development process; contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies            Required Qualifications:             8+ years of related consulting experience leading a team (both onshore and offshore) responsible for gathering non-functional requirements, performing designed and validated application architecture frameworks, and functional and testing assignments      5+ years of experience translating requirements into client ready design documents including modeling languages such as Unified Modeling Language (UML)      5+ years of experience with application architecture analysis, design and delivery using Open Source, .NET, and J2EE      5+ years of full system development life cycle implementations      A willingness to travel up to 10% of the time (while travel is a requirement for the role, non-essential travel has been limited until further notice)      Limited immigration sponsorship may be available            Preferred Qualifications:             Bachelor's Degree      Experience leading configuration and change management teams who were responsible for application deployments including the coordination of database changes and other necessary application configurations.      Experience using Azure DevOps environment.      Transactional database interaction experience, with exposure to various techniques such as RowSet, ORM (Hibernate, NHibernate, EF), etc.      Experience in Machine Learning and AI      Experience or passion for implementing cloud solutions on Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform      Leading Testing efforts, including all phases: System, Integration, and Performance Testing and ensuring traceability      Exposure to enterprise applications such as Siebel, SAP, Peoplesoft, Oracle      Experience with Middleware and/or SOA base implementations      Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint)      Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment      Eagerness to mentor junior staff               Remote - US, New York, San Francisco, San Jose, Parsippany, Stamford, Rosslyn, Los Angeles, Boston, McLean, Seattle, Orange County, Washington DC, Austin, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, Philadelphia, Minneapolis, Sacramento, Baltimore, San Diego, Atlanta, Charlotte, Detroit, Miami, Orlando, Mechanicsburg, Pittsburgh, Tampa, Kansas City, Cleveland, Cincinnati, Phoenix, Indianapolis, St. Louis, Tallahassee, Nashville, Memphis        #HC22 #HCaaS22

Automation Anywhere is a global leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), empowering customers to automate business processes with intelligent software bots – AI-powered, digital workers that perform repetitive and manual tasks, resulting in dramatic productivity gains, optimized customer experience, and more engaged employees. The company offers the world's only cloud-native, web-based intelligent automation platform combining RPA, artificial intelligence, machine learning and analytics. Automation Anywhere has deployed nearly 3 million bots to support some of the world's largest enterprises across all industries in more than 90 countries. For more information about our portfolio, please visit us at www.automationanywhere.com. Our opportunity: We are seeking a creative and action-oriented marketer to help evolve our go-to-market function to the next level. This role reports directly to the Senior Director of Go-to-Market on the Product and Solutions Marketing team. The Director of Go-to-market is responsible for the strategy, development, launch, and upkeep of our sales plays, assets, and programs to help direct and indirect sales teams increase deal velocity and size, partnering closely with stakeholders to introduce new products, launch new materials, and train sales and partners. Location:  Remote role - ability to work within any U.S time zone You will make an impact by being responsible for: Partnering cross-functionally to devise and deliver compelling messaging, customer conversation content, sales enablement tools and programs aimed at specific industry and persona-based targets. Driving deal closure and improve win rates through sales training on the problems we solve for, assets we have, how to use those assets and when to use them. Collaborating with product and solutions marketing team to define and implement go-to-market plans for new product introductions. Serving as trusted expert for our go to market initiatives with a deep understanding of customer trends, buyers, use cases, and differentiation. Creating and fostering a scalable feedback loop internally to understand customer needs, ensure message efficacy, and deliver solutions to challenges uncovered. You will be a great fit if you have: Bachelor’s degree or MBA 10+ years product marketing experience in high-tech or similar industry with extensive experience defining and executing on go to market plans. Proven track record of developing compelling enablement and sales collateral and programs collaboratively with other teams while managing multiple projects and key deadlines. Highly motivated, technology savvy, self-starter with passion for driving business growth and the ability to work in a fast-paced disruptive environment. Have impeccable communication, writing, presentation development and delivery skills An organized project manager who is able to develop a clear and actionable work back plan and drive results You excel in these key competencies: Some sales background and/or direct exposure to sales (sales operations, strategy, enablement, etc.). Experience marketing automation products. Why Automation Anywhere? At our company each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way. Our technology is the game changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!  #LI-LD1 #LI-REMOTE

We Are:        Our Life Sciences Practice is evolving rapidly from selling products to delivering value through better patient outcomes. We work with our pharmaceutical, biotech, medical technology, distributor, and consumer health clients globally to redefine the future of the life sciences industry by combining the latest technology with scientific breakthroughs to redefine how medical treatments are discovered, developed, and delivered to patients around the world.        Medical Technology (MedTech) is part of the Accenture Life Sciences Practice that helps deliver more personalized healthcare and better patient outcomes. The practice works specifically with Medical Technology companies to develop solutions across the patient’s healthcare journey. We are growing and looking for managers to join our team!        You Are:        You are a MedTech maestro with tons of experience working at the best consulting firms, and leadership and management skills to spare. Your expertise? Advising clients on data-driven strategies to achieve their strategic, financial, and operational goals. You have the energy and drive in abundance, along with personal resilience, a passion for serving clients, and a love for continued learning. You have a flair for breaking down processes into logical parts and constructing crystal-clear reasoning and analyses – an aptitude you use to decimate problems. Communication and people skills? You have both in spades, and as a manager you are a natural at appreciating diverse perspectives and bringing out the best in teams.        Here are some of the opportunities available in our MedTech Practice! We would love to speak with you if you have proven experience in the following areas:        New Product Development - Work alongside the entire New Product Development value chain from conceptualization, research, product design & development to build smart and connected medical devices for their client.        Commercial  – Enable the application of AI, smart automation, machine learning and advanced analytics at scale to provide new offerings and improve patient experience.        Strategy  – Develop strategic business partnerships and joint ventures. Create operational strategies aligned to new business strategies.        Supply Chain and Manufacturing  - Optimize supply chain to support growth and cost objectives of companies. Lead the product lifecycle of a system or product to include manufacturing and supply.        M&A-  Identify the right strategic fit and make the best investment decisions that align with business objectives.        The Work:         Work with cross-functional client teams to architect and deliver end to end MedTech transformations connecting to patients through innovative digital solutions, often over the course of multiple years involving large scale re-design      Work with client’s Supply Management to improve their experience in areas of planning, sourcing, manufacturing, and distribution      Dive deep to get the lay of the land to strategize data driven hypotheses and make recommendations to support client’s MedTech Transformation goals      Lead global teams of 2-75+ to carry out client priorities to achieve long term success      Lead as a strategic advisor on world-class end-to-end transformations addressing key business challenges such as New Product Launch, New Distribution Models, Mergers & Acquisitions etc.      Facilitate effective collaboration with other Accenture teams in Strategy and Consulting Technology and Operations to bring the best of Accenture to clients      Develop relevant partnerships with Life Sciences clients through applying social skills, effective communication, and relationship building      Pinpoint ways in which Accenture can better support clients through qualifying, co-creating, and carrying out sales opportunities      Support the growth and operations of the Life Sciences MedTech practice at Accenture through active involvement and leadership      Manage junior members of the team and groom them for more responsibility           Here’s What You Need:         5 years of MedTech experience, in one of the following areas: Supply Chain, Mergers and Acquisitions, Commercial, New Product Development, or Strategy      3 years leading teams      3 years architecting and delivering MedTech End-to-End Transformations      Bachelor's Degree           Bonus Points:         You have an MBA at an accredited institution      Proven experience in working for a top tier consultancy      Experience working with Medical Technology executives applying excellent client-facing communication and interpersonal skills      Experience leading the delivery of a consulting project and a proven ability to handle issues and risks, with an understanding of appropriate and timely escalation.      Experience driving insights using digital practices, analytics, and technologies      Relationships in Medical Device companies           Questions about Travel?        The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are advised by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from several infectious disease authorities. Racking-up those air miles will have to wait, as weekly non-essential travel is currently suspended. For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only.        Accenture Overview        We are a global collective of innovators applying the New every day to improve the way the world works and lives. Help us show the world what’s possible as you partner with clients to unlock hidden value and deliver innovative solutions. Empowered with innovative tools, continuous learning and a global community of diverse talent and perspectives, we drive success in a new business architecture that redefines conventional practices. Our expertise spans 40+ industries across 120+ countries and impacts millions of lives every day. We turn ideas into reality. Job Description:        The Role         Lead data-oriented projects to support our various partners      Build relationships with and scope requirements from partners      Design solutions that meet partner requirements      Ensure conformity to the squad strategy for analytics      Demonstrate a mix of analytics and technical skills and/or Data Visualization tools.      Assist with the team’s goal of increasing self-service reporting/analytics           The Expertise and Skills You Bring         Bachelor's degree in business, mathematics, computer science or equivalent      Experience in consulting or corporate work experience focused on using data to uncover insights that drive action and communicating analyses to technical and non-technical audiences.      Experience in data analysis role with experience in working with large sophisticated data sets      At least 5 Years of experience as an expert user of data analytics visualization tools, including but not limited to Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Qlik, and SAP Business Objects      At least 5 Years of statistical analysis (e.g., descriptive statistics and knowledge of statistical significance), quantitative research, and experience gathering and interpreting data      Knowledge of advanced analytics tools and techniques to perform analysis and interpret data – some examples are: Snowflake, SQL, SAS, R, Python, etc. a plus      Project consulting experience including requirement discovery and solution design      You can summarize conclusion of requirements and research that bring insights clearly and concisely      A self-starter who enjoys taking the lead on project level work, including but not limited to determining approach, tools, and output required      Possess organizational and time management skills with a demonstrable ability to meet deadlines      Strong analytical, storytelling skills and will thrive managing concurrent projects      Enjoy building, figuring out the best way to achieve results      Extensive experience in partnering with collaborators to understand their business needs and deliver data analytic solutions      Bring a data-driven approach to decision making.      Exercise extreme ownership over all your tasks and take accountability for your team’s results           The Team     As a NextGen Analytics, Principal Analyst you will work with a team of passionate associate who are a part of the NextGen Advanced Analytics Squad. You will be responsible for discovering, designing and delivering reporting and analysis solutions for partners. This team is the go-to analytic consultants for the NextGen platform. This role will understand business needs, scope data requests, create insights, and recommending solutions to key business partners and collaborate with other colleagues.     This team is a part of the Core Brokerage Platform & Technology domain and looks to design and deliver data via reports, dashboards and self-service tools. The squad will bring data that enhance decision making for each brokerage business capability and holistically for the firm. In addition, this role will establish analytics which discover insights that add value to improve productivity, efficiency and the customer experience. The squad also delivers data science solutions (artificial intelligence and machine learning) by leveraging distributed cloud technology        Certifications:        Company Overview      Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission  to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients.  We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.         Join Us      At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Job Title:    Asset Performance Analytics Technical Leader          Location:    Charlotte, NC          Job Summary and Description:          Leads research efforts in particular scientific disciplines or technologies and participates the development and application of products and services in those areas through contractors and departmental or cross-functional teams.             Applies technical expertise, and has full knowledge of other related disciplines. Develops technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity. Organizes the external and interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget. May conduct research directly in complex, high impact technical or scientific fields.             Familiar with transmission and substation (T&S) assets. Ability to ideate and solve T&S asset related problems using analytical approaches.             Demonstrated ability and prior experience in:                     Applying appropriate statistical and/or operations research methods in data analyses to better understand transmission asset performance (e.g., hazard rate development using survival analysis, spare strategy evaluation using large-scale discrete event simulation)                    Working with transmission and distribution (T&D) equipment test, maintenance, inspection and assessment data (e.g., power transformer dissolved gas analysis, circuit breaker maintenance records, transmission line inspection data etc.). Skilled in data engineering, data manipulation, data visualization and analysis. Categorization of descriptive text records (e.g., maintenance, field test reports etc.) into meaningful categories                    Applying techniques such as Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing to better understand Transmission and Distribution asset performance                    Analyzing time-series data (e.g., data from SCADA, digital relays, fault recorders) to better understand transmission and distribution (T&D) asset performance                    Applying mathematics and statistics using various data science techniques, including open-ended data-mining of readily-available datasets, model building and validation, and simulation                    Demonstrated ability to work with R (tidyverse), Python (NumPy, SciPy), MATLAB, SQL, database tools for data analysis.                  Additional Job Information:          Education:                        Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field or equivalent experience required.                  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:                     5 -7 or more years of research and development project and promotional experience, including development of advanced concepts for internal research or equivalent experience.                    Shows technical expertise and assumes responsibility for highly specialized technical objectives using creative imaginative solutions.                    Experience in performing and/or managing research activities.                    Incumbents must be able to exercise judgment, diligence, and attention to detail and demonstrate an aptitude for carrying out responsible technical assignments.                    Good verbal and written communication skills.                    Manages projects and may work in conjunction with a technical specialist.                    Developing technical depth in 1-2 areas                    Understand how work fits across EPRI programs                    Typically individual contributor, may begin handling supervisory activities for lower level positions.            EPRI participates in E-Verify, an online system operated jointly by the Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration (SSA). EPRI uses the system to check the work status of new hires by comparing information from the employee's I-9 form against SSA and Department of Homeland Security databases.    Note: To ensure compliance with U.S. export controls, please indicate your U.S. citizenship or (for foreign citizens) your U.S. visa/immigration status in your resume or cover letter. job_title: Consumer Insights – Decision Sciences and Analytics Lead for Americas
job_Description: Company Description    Jobs for Humanity is dedicated to building an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. Therefore, we have dedicated this job posting to individuals coming from the following communities: Refugee, Neurodivergent, Single Parent, Blind or Low Vision, Ethnic Minority, and the Previously Incarcerated.
